intro: Oxytropis lycotriche, commonly known as the yellow locoweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in arid conditions. Oxytropis lycotriche is also known for its toxic properties, which can affect livestock if ingested.
